title: Write unit tests for DocumentationStream
description:
Write comprehensive unit tests for the DocumentationStream class.

**Test Cases:**

1. **Initialization Tests:**
   - Test initialization with valid model configs
   - Test stream_id assignment (A or B)
   - Test static_oracle injection

2. **Documenter Agent Tests:**
   - Test generates valid DocumentationOutput schema
   - Test includes all required fields (component_id, documentation, call_graph, metadata)
   - Test processes components in provided order
   - Test includes dependency context from prior components
   - Mock LLM responses for deterministic testing

3. **Validator Agent Tests:**
   - Test generates valid ValidationResult schema
   - Test validation_result field (pass/fail/warning)
   - Test completeness scoring
   - Test call_graph_accuracy calculation against ground truth
   - Test corrections_applied when discrepancies found

4. **Pipeline Integration Tests:**
   - Test full documenter -> validator flow
   - Test output passes to next component as dependency context
   - Test apply_correction method updates internal state

5. **Error Handling Tests:**
   - Test handles LLM timeout gracefully
   - Test handles invalid component gracefully
   - Test handles empty source code

**Mocking Strategy:**
- Mock LLM client to return predetermined responses
- Mock StaticAnalysisOracle to return known call graphs
- Use pytest fixtures for reusable test data

Reference: Sections 3.1 and 3.2 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Design agent architecture for documenter and validator agents
description:
Design the architecture for the documenter agents (A1, B1) and validator agents (A2, B2). This includes:

1. **Agent Interface Design:**
   - Define abstract base class for agents
   - Specify input/output contracts matching JSON schemas in spec
   - Design system prompt templates structure

2. **Documenter Agent Architecture (A1/B1):**
   - Model tier: Generation (Claude Sonnet 4.5 / GPT-4o)
   - Input: source code component, dependency context, static analysis hints
   - Output: DocumentationOutput schema with component_id, documentation, call_graph, metadata
   - Processing order: topological (dependencies first)

3. **Validator Agent Architecture (A2/B2):**
   - Model tier: Validation (Claude Haiku 4.5 / GPT-4o-mini)
   - Input: documentation output, source code, static analysis call graph
   - Output: ValidationResult schema with validation_result, completeness, call_graph_accuracy, corrections_applied
   - Validation checks: parameter completeness, return type, callees/callers accuracy

4. **Stream Architecture:**
   - Design DocumentationStream class structure
   - Define how A1->A2 and B1->B2 pipelines work
   - Specify correction application mechanism

Reference: Sections 3.1 and 3.2 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement StaticAnalysisOracle with PyCG integration
description:
Implement the static analysis ground truth system:
- static_analysis/oracle.py: StaticAnalysisOracle class with cached_property for call_graph
- static_analysis/pycg_analyzer.py: PyCG integration for Python call graph extraction
- static_analysis/normalizer.py: Normalize raw PyCG output to CallGraph format
- Implement get_callees(), get_callers(), verify_edge(), diff_against() methods
- Handle PyCG subprocess execution and JSON parsing

Reference spec section: 6.2

title: Design API contracts for agent interfaces
description:
Design the API contracts and interfaces for all agent types:
- DocumenterAgent interface (A1, B1): input/output contracts for documentation generation
- ValidatorAgent interface (A2, B2): input/output contracts for validation
- ComparatorAgent interface (C): input/output contracts for comparison and arbitration
- DocumentationStream: interface for managing a complete stream (documenter + validator pair)

Define abstract base classes with clear method signatures. Include async support.
Reference spec sections: 3.1, 3.2, 3.3

title: Write unit tests for static analysis
description:
Write unit tests for static analysis integration:
- tests/test_static_analysis/test_oracle.py
- tests/test_static_analysis/test_pycg_analyzer.py
- tests/test_static_analysis/test_normalizer.py

Test cases:
- Call graph extraction from simple codebase
- get_callees() and get_callers() methods
- verify_edge() method
- diff_against() precision/recall calculation
- Fallback to pyan3 when PyCG fails
- Normalization of raw output

Use sample Python files as test fixtures.

title: Implement Validator Agent (A2/B2)
description:
Implement the validator agent that verifies documentation:
- agents/validator.py: ValidatorAgent class
- System prompt template as specified in section 3.2
- Validate documentation completeness (all params, returns, exceptions)
- Validate call graph accuracy against static analysis ground truth
- Apply corrections when discrepancies found
- Support for both Claude Haiku 4.5 and GPT-4o-mini

Validation checks (Table in 3.2):
- Parameter completeness
- Return type documented
- Callees accuracy (>5% false positive = fail)
- Callers accuracy (>10% missing = fail)
- Docstring format validation

Input: DocumentationOutput, source code, static analysis call graph
Output: ValidationResult schema
Reference spec section: 3.2

title: Implement YAML configuration loader
description:
Implement configuration management using YAML files and environment variables.

**Configuration Files:**

1. **config.yaml** (main configuration):
```yaml
codebase:
  path: /path/to/legacy/codebase
  language: python
  exclude_patterns: ['**/test_*', '**/tests/**', '**/__pycache__/**']

models:
  stream_a:
    documenter: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929
    validator: claude-haiku-4-5-20251001
  stream_b:
    documenter: gpt-4o
    validator: gpt-4o-mini
  comparator: claude-opus-4-5-20251101

convergence:
  max_iterations: 5
  call_graph_match_threshold: 0.98
  documentation_similarity_threshold: 0.95

Beads:
  server: https://your-org.atlassian.net
  project: LEGACY_DOC
  rebuild_project: REBUILD

output:
  documentation_path: ./output/documentation.json
  call_graph_path: ./output/call_graph.json
```

2. **static_analysis_config.yaml**:
```yaml
python:
  primary: pycg
  fallback: pyan3
java:
  primary: java-callgraph-static
  fallback: wala
```

**Environment Variables (.env):**
- OPENROUTER_API_KEY for LLM calls
- BEADS_API_TOKEN for Beads integration

**Implementation:**
- Create .env.example template
- Use pydantic-settings or python-dotenv
- Validate configuration on load
- Support config override via CLI arguments

Reference: Section 2.2 and Appendix C of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Create test fixtures and sample codebase
description:
Create test fixtures for all tests:
- tests/fixtures/sample_codebase/: Small Python project with various patterns
  - Functions with parameters and return types
  - Classes with methods
  - Inter-component calls for call graph testing
  - Edge cases (decorators, async functions, nested classes)
- tests/fixtures/llm_responses/: Mocked LLM response JSON files
- tests/fixtures/static_analysis/: Sample PyCG output
- tests/fixtures/discrepancies/: Sample discrepancy scenarios

Document each fixture and its purpose.

title: Implement CLI entry point
description:
Implement the command-line interface:
- cli.py or __main__.py: Main entry point
- Parse command-line arguments:
  - --config: path to config.yaml
  - --codebase: path to codebase (override config)
  - --language: language (python/java/javascript)
  - --max-iterations: max iterations override
  - --output-dir: output directory
  - --dry-run: analyze without creating tickets
- Load configuration
- Initialize and run DualStreamOrchestrator
- Save outputs (documentation.json, call_graph.json)
- Display summary statistics using rich

Reference spec section: 7.1 (Entry point)

title: Design configuration management system
description:
Design the configuration management system including:
- YAML configuration schema (codebase, models, convergence, Beads, static_analysis, output paths)
- Environment variable handling (.env support via python-dotenv)
- OpenRouter API key management
- Model configuration mapping (ModelTier enum, ModelConfig dataclass)
- Configuration validation and defaults

Create .env.example template for required API keys.
Reference spec sections: 2.2, 7.2, Appendix C

title: Set up CI/CD pipeline
description:
Set up continuous integration pipeline:
- .github/workflows/ci.yaml: GitHub Actions workflow
- Run on push and pull request
- Jobs:
  - lint: ruff for linting
  - type-check: mypy for type checking
  - test: pytest with coverage
  - build: verify package builds correctly
- Coverage upload to codecov or similar
- Fail on coverage below 80%
- Cache pip dependencies for speed

Consider adding pre-commit hooks configuration.

title: Implement Comparator Agent (C)
description:
Implement the comparator/arbitrator agent:
- agents/comparator.py: ComparatorAgent class
- System prompt template as specified in section 3.3
- Compare outputs from Stream A and Stream B component-by-component
- Identify all discrepancies (structural and semantic)
- Consult ground truth for call graph discrepancies
- Apply decision logic (section 3.3):
  - Accept identical outputs
  - Resolve call graph discrepancies via static analysis
  - Flag documentation content discrepancies for review
- Generate Beads ticket data for unresolved issues
- Track convergence progress

Input: Validated outputs from both streams, static analysis ground truth
Output: ComparisonResult schema
Uses Claude Opus 4.5 for complex reasoning
Reference spec section: 3.3

title: Implement system prompt templates
description:
Implement system prompt templates for documenter, validator, and comparator agents.

**Templates to Implement:**

1. **Documenter System Prompt (Section 3.1):**
```
You are a code documentation agent. Your task is to generate comprehensive 
documentation for code components including accurate call graph linkages.

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:
1. Document ALL parameters, return values, and exceptions
2. Identify ALL function/method calls made BY this component (callees)
3. When available, identify callers OF this component
4. Be precise about call site line numbers
5. Distinguish between direct calls, conditional calls, and calls in loops

You have access to:
- The source code of the focal component
- Documentation of dependencies (already processed)
- Optional static analysis hints

Output in the specified JSON schema. Do not hallucinate call relationships 
that don't exist in the code.
```

2. **Validator System Prompt (Section 3.2):**
```
You are a documentation validation agent. Your task is to verify that 
documentation is complete and that call graph linkages are accurate.

VALIDATION RULES:
- All parameters in code must be documented
- All return paths must be documented
- All exceptions that can be raised must be documented
- Call graph MUST match static analysis (static analysis wins if conflict)
```

3. **Comparator System Prompt (Section 3.3):**
```
You are the arbitration agent responsible for comparing documentation outputs 
from two independent streams and resolving discrepancies.

DECISION HIERARCHY:
1. Static analysis is AUTHORITATIVE for call graph accuracy
2. For semantic/content differences, prefer completeness and accuracy
3. When uncertain (confidence < 0.7), generate Beads ticket
4. Never guess - escalate unclear cases
```

**Implementation:**
- Store templates in separate files or as constants
- Support template variable substitution
- Include JSON schema instructions in prompts

Reference: Sections 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement DualStreamOrchestrator
description:
Implement the main orchestrator that coordinates the entire pipeline:
- orchestrator.py: DualStreamOrchestrator class
- __init__: Initialize all components (streams, comparator, oracle, Beads manager)
- run(): Execute the full documentation pipeline
- _discover_components(): Use AST parser to find all components
- _topological_sort(): Order components by dependencies
- _apply_correction(): Apply corrections based on comparison
- _merge_outputs(): Merge converged outputs from both streams
- _generate_rebuild_tickets(): Create Beads tickets for rebuild
- _generate_convergence_report(): Create final report

Implement the iteration loop from section 4.1:
1. Parallel documentation (asyncio.gather)
2. Comparison
3. Resolution (ground truth or Beads tickets)
4. Iteration check

Reference spec section: 7.1

title: Implement DocumentationStream class
description:
Implement the DocumentationStream class that encapsulates a documenter + validator agent pair.

**Class Structure:**
```python
class DocumentationStream:
    def __init__(self, stream_id: str, documenter_model: ModelConfig, 
                 validator_model: ModelConfig, static_oracle: StaticAnalysisOracle)
    async def process(self, processing_order: List[Component]) -> StreamOutput
    async def apply_correction(self, component_id: str, corrected_value: Any) -> None
```

**Documenter Agent (A1/B1):**
- Generate documentation using system prompt template from spec Section 3.1
- Output matches DocumentationOutput schema
- Process components in topological order
- Include dependency context from already-processed components

**Validator Agent (A2/B2):**
- Validate documentation against source code and static analysis
- Apply validation checks: parameter completeness, return type, call graph accuracy
- Output matches ValidationResult schema
- Apply corrections when static analysis differs from documentation

**Pipeline Flow:**
1. Documenter receives component + dependency context
2. Documenter generates documentation with call graph
3. Validator receives documentation + static analysis ground truth
4. Validator verifies and corrects call graph against ground truth
5. Return validated output

Reference: Sections 3.1 and 3.2 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Set up test infrastructure
description:
Set up the testing infrastructure:
- pytest configuration in pyproject.toml
- pytest-asyncio for async test support
- pytest-cov for coverage reporting
- conftest.py with common fixtures
- tests/ directory structure mirroring src/
- Mock fixtures for LLM clients (avoid real API calls in tests)
- Sample codebase fixtures for testing

Configure minimum 80% coverage target.

title: Set up project structure and dependencies
description:
Initialize the Python project with:
- pyproject.toml with all dependencies (anthropic, openai, langgraph, pycg, pyan3, Beads, pydantic, aiohttp, tenacity, rich)
- Directory structure: src/twinscribe/{agents/, static_analysis/, Beads/, models/, utils/}
- __init__.py files and package setup
- .env.example with required environment variables
- .gitignore for Python projects
- README.md with basic setup instructions

Reference spec section: 7.2

title: Implement metrics and logging
description:
Implement the metrics collection and logging system:
- utils/metrics.py: MetricsCollector class
- Track key metrics from section 8.1:
  - Convergence rate
  - Iterations to converge
  - Call graph precision and recall
  - Beads ticket rate
  - Cost per component
- utils/logger.py: Structured logging with JSON output
- Implement logging schema from section 8.2
- Cost tracking per stream and total
- Duration tracking

Reference spec sections: 8.1, 8.2

title: Implement configuration loader
description:
Implement configuration loading and validation:
- config/loader.py: ConfigLoader class
- Load YAML configuration from config.yaml
- Load environment variables from .env
- Validate configuration against schema
- Provide defaults for optional settings
- Create SystemConfig object for use throughout application

Support configuration template from Appendix C.
Reference spec section: Appendix C

title: Implement pyan3 fallback analyzer
description:
Implement pyan3 as fallback static analyzer when PyCG fails:
- static_analysis/pyan_analyzer.py: pyan3 integration
- Parse pyan3 output and normalize to CallGraph format
- Integrate with StaticAnalysisOracle fallback mechanism
- Handle edge cases where pyan3 output differs from PyCG

Reference spec section: 6.1 (python config showing pyan3 as fallback)

title: Design LLM client abstraction for OpenRouter
description:
Design the LLMClient abstraction that wraps OpenRouter API. Should support:
- Multiple providers (Anthropic, OpenAI) through OpenRouter
- Async operations
- Token usage tracking
- Rate limiting and retry logic
- Cost estimation based on model configuration

This is a dependency for all agent implementations.

title: Write unit tests for StaticAnalysisOracle
description:
Write comprehensive unit tests for the StaticAnalysisOracle class.

**Test Cases:**

1. **Initialization Tests:**
   - Test initialization with valid Python codebase
   - Test initialization with invalid path (should raise)
   - Test language-specific analyzer selection

2. **Call Graph Extraction Tests:**
   - Test call_graph property returns valid CallGraph
   - Test caching behavior (call_graph is cached)
   - Test with empty codebase
   - Test with complex dependency chains

3. **get_callees Tests:**
   - Test returns correct callees for known component
   - Test returns empty list for leaf component (no outgoing calls)
   - Test handles non-existent component_id gracefully

4. **get_callers Tests:**
   - Test returns correct callers for known component
   - Test returns empty list for entry point (no incoming calls)
   - Test handles non-existent component_id gracefully

5. **verify_edge Tests:**
   - Test returns True for existing edge
   - Test returns False for non-existing edge
   - Test with edge in both directions

6. **diff_against Tests:**
   - Test with identical graphs (precision=1.0, recall=1.0)
   - Test with missing edges in documented graph (recall < 1.0)
   - Test with extra edges in documented graph (precision < 1.0)
   - Test precision/recall calculation correctness

**Test Fixtures:**
- Create sample Python files with known call relationships
- Create expected CallGraph objects for verification

Reference: Section 6.2 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md
close_reason:
Comprehensive unit tests for StaticAnalysisOracle with 57 tests achieving 92.77% coverage (exceeding 80% target). Tests cover:
- Initialization: valid path, invalid path, language normalization, custom analyzer config
- Call graph extraction: caching behavior, empty codebase, complex dependency chains
- get_callees: known component, leaf component, non-existent component
- get_callers: known component, entry point, non-existent component  
- verify_edge: existing edge, non-existing edge, bidirectional edges
- diff_against: identical graphs, empty documented graph, extra edges, precision/recall calculation
- PyCGAnalyzer: creation, availability check, parse output (valid/invalid/empty), analyze method
- Pyan3Analyzer: creation, availability check, parse output (valid/invalid/empty/filters), analyze method
- Error handling: AnalyzerNotAvailableError, AnalyzerExecutionError, timeout handling
- BaseAnalyzer._run_command: success, with cwd, generic exception handling

title: Implement OpenRouter LLM client wrapper
description:
Implement a unified LLM client that uses OpenRouter:
- utils/llm_client.py: AsyncLLMClient class
- Support for both Anthropic (Claude) and OpenAI (GPT) models via OpenRouter
- Rate limiting and retry logic using tenacity
- Token usage tracking for cost calculation
- Async message sending with proper error handling
- Model configuration from MODELS dict

Reference spec sections: 2.2, 7.1

title: Implement convergence checking logic
description:
Implement the convergence criteria checking:
- utils/convergence.py: ConvergenceChecker class
- Check hard thresholds: MAX_ITERATIONS (5)
- Check soft thresholds:
  - CALL_GRAPH_MATCH_RATE >= 0.98
  - DOCUMENTATION_SIMILARITY >= 0.95
  - MAX_OPEN_DISCREPANCIES <= 2
- Identify blocking discrepancy types:
  - missing_critical_call
  - false_critical_call
  - missing_public_api_doc
  - security_relevant_gap
- Return ConvergenceStatus with recommendation

Reference spec section: 4.2

title: Implement DualStreamOrchestrator class
description:
Implement the main DualStreamOrchestrator class that coordinates the entire documentation pipeline.

**Class Structure:**
```python
class DualStreamOrchestrator:
    def __init__(self, codebase_path: str, language: str, Beads_config: dict, max_iterations: int = 5)
    async def run(self) -> DocumentationPackage
    async def _discover_components(self) -> List[Component]
    def _topological_sort(self, components: List[Component]) -> List[Component]
    async def _apply_correction(self, discrepancy: dict) -> None
    async def _merge_outputs(self, output_a, output_b, comparison) -> dict
    async def _generate_rebuild_tickets(self, final_output: dict) -> List[dict]
    def _generate_convergence_report(self) -> dict
```

**Initialization:**
- Create StaticAnalysisOracle for ground truth
- Create BeadsLifecycleManager for ticket handling
- Create Stream A (Claude Sonnet + Haiku)
- Create Stream B (GPT-4o + GPT-4o-mini)
- Create ComparatorAgent (Claude Opus)

**Main Loop (run method):**
1. Discover components via AST parsing
2. Topological sort by dependencies
3. Iteration loop (max 5):
   - Parallel documentation with asyncio.gather
   - Comparison via ComparatorAgent
   - Convergence check
   - Handle discrepancies (Beads tickets or ground truth)
   - Apply corrections
4. Finalization: merge, generate rebuild tickets, report

**Output (DocumentationPackage):**
- documentation: final merged docs
- call_graph: verified call graph
- rebuild_tickets: list of Beads tickets
- convergence_report: iteration history and status

Reference: Section 7.1 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement ticket templates
description:
Implement the Beads ticket templates:
- beads/templates.py: TicketTemplates class
- discrepancy_template: Template for AI-DOC discrepancy tickets (section 5.1)
- rebuild_template: Template for rebuild/story tickets (section 5.1)
- Template rendering with variable substitution
- Support for markdown formatting and code snippets
- Labels and custom fields generation

Reference spec section: 5.1

title: Write unit tests for ComparatorAgent
description:
Write comprehensive unit tests for the ComparatorAgent class.

**Test Cases:**

1. **Comparison Logic Tests:**
   - Test identical outputs return no discrepancies
   - Test call graph discrepancy detection
   - Test documentation content discrepancy detection
   - Test multiple discrepancies in single component

2. **Resolution Logic Tests:**
   - Test accept_stream_a when A matches ground truth
   - Test accept_stream_b when B matches ground truth
   - Test needs_human_review when confidence < 0.7
   - Test blocking discrepancy types trigger correct handling

3. **Ground Truth Consultation Tests:**
   - Test call graph discrepancies resolved via static_oracle
   - Test verify_edge called for disputed edges
   - Test resolution correctly identifies matching stream

4. **Convergence Checking Tests:**
   - Test converged=True when all criteria met
   - Test converged=False when CALL_GRAPH_MATCH_RATE < 0.98
   - Test converged=False when blocking discrepancies exist
   - Test MAX_OPEN_DISCREPANCIES threshold

5. **Beads Ticket Generation Tests:**
   - Test requires_Beads=True for low confidence discrepancies
   - Test Beads ticket structure matches template
   - Test discrepancy_type and component_id in ticket

6. **Output Schema Tests:**
   - Test ComparisonResult has all required fields
   - Test summary statistics are accurate
   - Test discrepancies list format

Reference: Section 3.3 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Design Beads integration architecture
description:
Design the Beads ticket management integration:
- BeadsLifecycleManager class design
- Ticket templates for discrepancy tickets and rebuild tickets
- Resolution parsing and application logic
- Async ticket monitoring with timeout handling
- Tracker for mapping tickets to discrepancies

Define the interface for creating, monitoring, and applying resolutions from Beads tickets.
Reference spec sections: 5.1, 5.2

title: Write end-to-end tests with real LLM calls
description:
Write end-to-end tests that exercise the system with real LLM API calls.

**Prerequisites:**
- OpenRouter API key configured
- Beads test project available (or mocked)
- Small sample codebase with known structure

**Test Scenarios:**

1. **Single Component E2E:**
   - Document one simple Python function
   - Both streams use real LLM calls
   - Verify output matches expected schema
   - Verify call graph accuracy against PyCG

2. **Multi-Component E2E:**
   - Document 3-5 related functions with dependencies
   - Verify topological processing order
   - Verify dependency context passed correctly
   - Verify final documentation coherent

3. **Cost Tracking E2E:**
   - Run documentation on sample codebase
   - Verify cost metrics collected
   - Compare against expected cost projection:
     - Generation: ~$3/M tokens
     - Validation: ~$0.20/M tokens
     - Arbitration: ~$15/M tokens

4. **Model Diversity E2E:**
   - Verify Stream A uses Claude models
   - Verify Stream B uses OpenAI models
   - Verify ComparatorAgent uses Opus

**Test Configuration:**
- Mark as slow/integration tests
- Skip by default in CI (require explicit flag)
- Use minimal token budgets where possible
- Record responses for debugging

**Success Criteria:**
- Schema validation passes
- Call graph precision > 90%
- Call graph recall > 85%
- No unhandled exceptions

Reference: Section 7 and 8 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement convergence criteria and metrics
description:
Implement convergence criteria checking and metrics collection.

**Convergence Criteria (Section 4.2):**
```python
class ConvergenceCriteria:
    MAX_ITERATIONS = 5
    CALL_GRAPH_MATCH_RATE = 0.98
    DOCUMENTATION_SIMILARITY = 0.95
    MAX_OPEN_DISCREPANCIES = 2
    
    BLOCKING_DISCREPANCY_TYPES = [
        'missing_critical_call',
        'false_critical_call', 
        'missing_public_api_doc',
        'security_relevant_gap'
    ]
```

**Metrics to Track (Section 8.1):**
| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| Convergence Rate | >95% |
| Iterations to Converge | <3 |
| Call Graph Precision | >98% |
| Call Graph Recall | >95% |
| Beads Ticket Rate | <5% |
| Cost per Component | <$0.05 |

**Logging Schema (Section 8.2):**
```json
{
  'run_id': 'run_20260106_001',
  'timestamp': '2026-01-06T10:00:00Z',
  'metrics': {
    'components_total': 247,
    'iterations': 2,
    'convergence_status': 'converged',
    'call_graph': { 'precision': 0.987, 'recall': 0.962, 'f1': 0.974 },
    'discrepancies': { 'total': 15, 'resolved_by_ground_truth': 12 },
    'cost': { 'stream_a': 2.45, 'stream_b': 1.89, 'comparator': 1.12, 'total': 5.46 }
  }
}
```

**Implementation:**
- Create ConvergenceCriteria class
- Implement convergence check logic
- Create MetricsCollector class
- Log metrics in JSON format
- Track token usage and costs per model tier

Reference: Sections 4.2 and 8 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Write unit tests for data models
description:
Write comprehensive unit tests for all Pydantic models:
- tests/test_models/test_component.py
- tests/test_models/test_documentation.py
- tests/test_models/test_discrepancy.py
- tests/test_models/test_config.py

Test cases:
- Valid model instantiation
- JSON serialization/deserialization
- Validation error handling
- Edge cases (empty values, None handling)
- Model inheritance if applicable
close_reason: Created comprehensive unit tests for all data models with 169 tests achieving 85.11% coverage (exceeding 80% target). Test files cover: test_components.py (ComponentLocation, ParameterDoc, ReturnDoc, ExceptionDoc, ComponentDocumentation, Component), test_call_graph.py (CallEdge, CallGraph, CallGraphDiff), test_documentation.py (CalleeRef, CallerRef, CallGraphSection, DocumenterMetadata, DocumentationOutput, StreamOutput), test_validation.py (CompletenessCheck, CallGraphAccuracy, CorrectionApplied, ValidatorMetadata, ValidationResult), test_comparison.py (BeadsTicketRef, Discrepancy, ConvergenceStatus, ComparisonSummary, ComparatorMetadata, ComparisonResult), test_convergence.py (ConvergenceCriteria, ConvergenceHistoryEntry, ConvergenceReport). Tests cover validation bounds, computed properties, JSON serialization, edge cases, and error conditions.

title: Implement Documenter Agent (A1/B1)
description:
Implement the documenter agent that generates documentation:
- agents/documenter.py: DocumenterAgent class
- System prompt template as specified in section 3.1
- Process component with dependency context
- Generate documentation output following the JSON schema
- Support for both Claude Sonnet 4.5 and GPT-4o
- Include call graph inference from code analysis

Input: source code component, dependency context, static analysis hints
Output: DocumentationOutput schema as specified
Reference spec section: 3.1

title: Implement BeadsLifecycleManager
description:
Implement the Beads ticket management system:
- beads/lifecycle_manager.py: BeadsLifecycleManager class
- create_discrepancy_ticket(): Create tickets for discrepancies requiring human review
- wait_for_resolution(): Poll for ticket resolution with timeout (default 48h)
- apply_resolution(): Parse resolution from closed ticket and apply corrections
- render_template(): Render ticket templates with discrepancy data
- Tracker for mapping ticket keys to discrepancy IDs

Uses mustache-style templates from section 5.1.
Reference spec section: 5.2

title: Design static analysis oracle interface
description:
Design the StaticAnalysisOracle class that provides ground truth call graphs. Should support:
- Multiple analyzers (PyCG, pyan3 for Python)
- Normalized call graph format
- Query methods for callees/callers
- Diff comparison for validation
- Caching of analysis results

Reference: Section 6 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Write integration tests for dual-stream workflow
description:
Write integration tests that verify the complete dual-stream documentation workflow.

**Test Scenarios:**

1. **Happy Path - Full Convergence:**
   - Small codebase (5-10 components)
   - Both streams produce identical output
   - Verify convergence in iteration 1
   - Verify final documentation package complete

2. **Ground Truth Resolution:**
   - Codebase with known call relationships
   - Inject call graph discrepancy between streams
   - Verify static_oracle is consulted
   - Verify correct stream accepted
   - Verify correction applied to other stream

3. **Beads Ticket Generation:**
   - Documentation content discrepancy (not call graph)
   - Low confidence resolution (< 0.7)
   - Verify Beads ticket created
   - Mock ticket resolution
   - Verify resolution applied

4. **Multi-Iteration Convergence:**
   - Multiple discrepancies requiring iterations
   - Verify iteration count increments
   - Verify only changed components re-processed
   - Verify convergence after corrections

5. **Max Iterations Reached:**
   - Unresolvable discrepancies
   - Verify exits after MAX_ITERATIONS (5)
   - Verify remaining discrepancies logged
   - Verify partial output still produced

6. **Parallel Execution:**
   - Verify Stream A and B run in parallel
   - Verify processing order respected (topological)
   - Measure timing to confirm parallelism

**Test Infrastructure:**
- Use pytest-asyncio for async tests
- Create sample codebase fixtures
- Mock external APIs (LLM, Beads)
- Verify metrics collection during tests

Reference: Section 4 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Design orchestrator workflow and iteration loop
description:
Design the DualStreamOrchestrator class that coordinates the entire documentation pipeline.

1. **Initialization Phase:**
   - Parse codebase to AST
   - Build dependency graph
   - Run static analysis to get ground truth call graph
   - Topological sort for processing order
   - Initialize both streams

2. **Iteration Loop Design:**
   - Step 1: Parallel documentation (both streams run simultaneously using asyncio.gather)
   - Step 2: Comparison (ComparatorAgent compares outputs)
   - Step 3: Resolution (convergence check, Beads ticket handling, corrections)
   - Step 4: Iteration check (max iterations, re-process only changed components)

3. **Finalization Phase:**
   - Merge converged outputs
   - Generate final documentation package
   - Generate Beads rebuild tickets
   - Produce convergence report

4. **State Management:**
   - Track iteration count
   - Maintain convergence history
   - Handle partial convergence and timeouts

Reference: Section 4.1 and 7.1 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Write unit tests for Beads integration
description:
Write unit tests for Beads integration with mocked API:
- tests/test_beads/test_lifecycle_manager.py
- tests/test_beads/test_templates.py

Test cases:
- Ticket template rendering
- Discrepancy ticket creation
- Resolution polling logic
- Resolution parsing (Stream A, Stream B, merged)
- apply_resolution() corrections
- Timeout handling
- Error handling for API failures

Mock Beads API to avoid real ticket creation.

title: Write unit tests for agents
description:
Write unit tests for all agents with mocked LLM responses:
- tests/test_agents/test_documenter.py
- tests/test_agents/test_validator.py
- tests/test_agents/test_comparator.py
- tests/test_agents/test_stream.py

Test cases:
- Documenter generates valid DocumentationOutput
- Validator correctly validates complete documentation
- Validator detects missing parameters
- Validator detects call graph discrepancies
- Comparator identifies identical outputs
- Comparator detects discrepancies
- Comparator uses ground truth for resolution
- Stream processes components in order

Mock LLM responses to avoid API costs in tests.

title: Write unit tests for convergence
description:
Write unit tests for convergence checking:
- tests/test_utils/test_convergence.py

Test cases:
- Convergence met when all thresholds passed
- Convergence blocked by high discrepancy count
- Convergence blocked by low call graph match rate
- Convergence blocked by blocking discrepancy types
- Max iterations reached handling
- Edge cases (0 components, 100% match)

Reference convergence criteria from section 4.2.

title: Design comparator agent and arbitration logic
description:
Design the ComparatorAgent (C) architecture for comparing outputs from both streams and resolving discrepancies.

1. **Comparator Agent Design:**
   - Model tier: Arbitration (Claude Opus 4.5)
   - Input: validated output from Stream A, Stream B, static analysis ground truth, previous iteration context
   - Output: ComparisonResult schema with discrepancies, resolution decisions, Beads ticket info

2. **Decision Logic Implementation:**
   - If stream_a == stream_b: ACCEPT (identical)
   - If call_graph discrepancy: consult static analysis ground truth, accept matching stream
   - If documentation_content discrepancy: use judgment or escalate to Beads
   - Confidence threshold: < 0.7 generates Beads ticket

3. **Convergence Criteria:**
   - MAX_ITERATIONS = 5
   - CALL_GRAPH_MATCH_RATE = 0.98
   - DOCUMENTATION_SIMILARITY = 0.95
   - MAX_OPEN_DISCREPANCIES = 2
   - Define BLOCKING_DISCREPANCY_TYPES

4. **Integration Points:**
   - Connection to BeadsLifecycleManager for ticket creation
   - Connection to StaticAnalysisOracle for ground truth
   - Correction propagation to streams

Reference: Section 3.3 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement DocumentationStream class
description:
Implement the documentation stream that combines documenter and validator:
- agents/stream.py: DocumentationStream class
- Initialize with documenter model and validator model
- process(components) method: iterate through components in topological order
- For each component: run documenter, then run validator
- Store validated outputs
- apply_correction() method for updating outputs based on comparison results
- Track processing progress and token usage

Reference spec section: 4.1 (Step 1: Parallel Documentation)

title: Define core data models and Pydantic schemas
description:
Define all Pydantic models for the system including:
- Component: represents a code component (function, method, class)
- CallEdge: represents a call relationship between components
- CallGraph: collection of call edges with graph operations
- DocumentationOutput: output schema from documenter agents (section 3.1)
- ValidationResult: output schema from validator agents (section 3.2)
- Discrepancy: represents a difference between streams
- ComparisonResult: output schema from comparator agent (section 3.3)
- ConvergenceCriteria and ConvergenceStatus: convergence tracking
- DocumentationPackage: final output structure

All schemas must support JSON serialization. Include proper type hints and validation.
Reference spec sections: 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 4.2

title: Write unit tests for BeadsLifecycleManager
description:
Write comprehensive unit tests for the BeadsLifecycleManager class.

**Test Cases:**

1. **Ticket Creation Tests:**
   - Test create_discrepancy_ticket returns valid ticket key
   - Test ticket summary matches expected format: [AI-DOC] {type}: {component}
   - Test ticket description contains required sections
   - Test labels are correctly applied
   - Test custom_fields are set

2. **Template Rendering Tests:**
   - Test render_template for discrepancy ticket
   - Test render_template for rebuild ticket
   - Test template variables are correctly substituted
   - Test Mustache-style conditionals work ({{#if}}, {{#each}})

3. **Resolution Waiting Tests:**
   - Test wait_for_resolution returns when all tickets closed
   - Test timeout handling (returns pending tickets list)
   - Test polling interval (5 minutes)
   - Test partial resolution handling

4. **Resolution Parsing Tests:**
   - Test parse_resolution extracts chosen_stream from checkbox
   - Test parse_resolution handles custom merged version
   - Test parse_resolution from comments
   - Test handles malformed resolution gracefully

5. **Resolution Application Tests:**
   - Test apply_resolution calls correct stream correction
   - Test Stream A correction when B is correct
   - Test Stream B correction when A is correct
   - Test both streams updated for merged resolution

**Mocking Strategy:**
- Mock Beads API client
- Mock ticket creation/retrieval
- Use asyncio test utilities for async methods

Reference: Section 5 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement ComparatorAgent class
description:
Implement the ComparatorAgent class for comparing outputs from both streams and resolving discrepancies.

**Class Structure:**
```python
class ComparatorAgent:
    def __init__(self, model: ModelConfig, static_oracle: StaticAnalysisOracle)
    async def compare(self, output_a: StreamOutput, output_b: StreamOutput) -> ComparisonResult
    def _compare_call_graphs(self, graph_a: CallGraph, graph_b: CallGraph) -> List[Discrepancy]
    def _compare_documentation(self, doc_a: dict, doc_b: dict) -> List[Discrepancy]
    def _resolve_discrepancy(self, discrepancy: Discrepancy) -> Resolution
```

**Decision Logic:**
- Identical outputs: ACCEPT
- Call graph discrepancy: consult static_oracle ground truth, accept matching stream
- Documentation content discrepancy: 
  - High confidence (>= 0.7): accept better stream
  - Low confidence (< 0.7): generate Beads ticket

**Output Schema (ComparisonResult):**
- comparison_id, iteration
- summary: total_components, identical, discrepancies, resolved_by_ground_truth, requires_human_review
- discrepancies: list with discrepancy_id, component_id, type, stream values, resolution, requires_Beads
- convergence_status: converged (bool), blocking_discrepancies, recommendation

**Convergence Criteria:**
- CALL_GRAPH_MATCH_RATE = 0.98
- DOCUMENTATION_SIMILARITY = 0.95
- MAX_OPEN_DISCREPANCIES = 2
- Check BLOCKING_DISCREPANCY_TYPES

Reference: Section 3.3 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Configure type checking with mypy
description:
Configure mypy for static type checking:
- Add mypy configuration to pyproject.toml
- Add type stubs for external dependencies (types-*)
- Ensure all modules pass mypy strict mode
- Add py.typed marker file
- Document any type: ignore comments with reasons

Target: zero mypy errors in strict mode.
close_reason: Mypy configuration completed in pyproject.toml with strict mode, all type checking options enabled. Pre-commit hook configured in .pre-commit-config.yaml.

title: Create sample Python codebase for testing
description:
Create a well-structured sample Python codebase for testing the documentation system.

**Requirements:**

1. **Component Variety:**
   - Simple functions (no dependencies)
   - Functions calling other functions
   - Classes with methods
   - Class inheritance
   - Module-level code

2. **Call Graph Patterns:**
   - Direct calls
   - Conditional calls (in if/else)
   - Loop calls (in for/while)
   - Recursive calls
   - Cross-module calls

3. **Documentation Challenges:**
   - Multiple parameters with types
   - Multiple return paths
   - Exception raising
   - Default parameter values
   - *args and **kwargs

4. **Structure:**
```
sample_codebase/
  __init__.py
  core/
    __init__.py
    processor.py    # Main logic, many dependencies
    validators.py   # Input validation functions
  utils/
    __init__.py
    helpers.py      # Utility functions
    formatters.py   # Output formatting
  models/
    __init__.py
    entities.py     # Data classes
  main.py           # Entry point
```

5. **Known Ground Truth:**
   - Document expected call graph edges
   - Create expected documentation output
   - Use for test assertions

6. **Size:**
   - ~15-20 documentable components
   - Complex enough for meaningful tests
   - Small enough for fast test execution

Reference: Used throughout testing tasks
close_reason: Created comprehensive sample Python codebase with modular structure: core/ (processor.py, validators.py), utils/ (helpers.py, formatters.py), models/ (entities.py), and main.py. Includes 36 documented functions/methods with 31 call graph edges covering direct calls, conditional calls, loop calls, recursive calls, and callbacks. Ground truth call graph documented in tests/fixtures/static_analysis/call_graph_ground_truth.json.

title: Implement AST parser and component discovery
description:
Implement the codebase parsing and component discovery system:
- utils/ast_parser.py: Parse Python source files to AST
- utils/component_discovery.py: Discover all documentable components (functions, methods, classes)
- Build dependency graph between components
- Extract parameter info, return types, exceptions from AST
- utils/topological_sort.py: Topological sort for processing order

Focus on Python initially. Support for other languages can be added later.
Reference spec section: 4.1 (Initialization steps 1-4)

title: Write integration tests for orchestrator
description:
Write integration tests for the full pipeline:
- tests/integration/test_orchestrator.py
- tests/integration/test_end_to_end.py

Test cases:
- Full pipeline with small sample codebase
- Convergence in single iteration (identical outputs)
- Convergence after corrections
- Beads ticket generation for unresolved discrepancies
- Max iterations handling
- Output file generation

Use mocked LLM responses but real static analysis.
Include sample Python codebase in tests/fixtures/.

title: Implement StaticAnalysisOracle class
description:
Implement the StaticAnalysisOracle class that provides ground truth call graph from static analysis.

**Class Structure:**
```python
class StaticAnalysisOracle:
    def __init__(self, codebase_path: str, language: str)
    def _get_analyzer(self, language: str) -> Analyzer
    @cached_property
    def call_graph(self) -> CallGraph
    def get_callees(self, component_id: str) -> List[CallEdge]
    def get_callers(self, component_id: str) -> List[CallEdge]
    def verify_edge(self, caller: str, callee: str) -> bool
    def diff_against(self, documented_graph: CallGraph) -> CallGraphDiff
```

**Analyzer Integrations:**
- Python: PyCG (primary), pyan3 (fallback)
- Java: java-callgraph-static (primary), WALA (fallback)
- JavaScript/TypeScript: typescript-call-graph
- Multi-language: Sourcetrail (fallback)

**Data Structures:**
- CallGraph: contains edges list
- CallEdge: caller, callee, call_site_line, call_type
- CallGraphDiff: missing_in_doc, extra_in_doc, matching, precision, recall

**Configuration:**
- Load analyzer config from static_analysis_config.yaml
- Support language-specific tool selection
- Handle fallback when primary tool fails

Reference: Section 6.2 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Design static analysis integration architecture
description:
Design the static analysis integration layer including:
- StaticAnalysisOracle interface for ground truth extraction
- Analyzer abstract class for language-specific implementations
- CallGraphDiff structure for comparing call graphs
- Configuration schema for static analysis tools (PyCG, pyan3, java-callgraph, etc.)

Define how static analysis results are normalized to a common CallGraph format.
Support fallback analyzers when primary fails.
Reference spec sections: 6.1, 6.2

title: Configure linting with ruff
description:
Configure ruff for code linting and formatting:
- Add ruff configuration to pyproject.toml
- Enable relevant rule sets (pyflakes, pycodestyle, isort, etc.)
- Configure line length and other formatting options
- Add pre-commit hook for ruff
- Document any rule exclusions with reasons

Target: zero ruff errors/warnings.
close_reason: Ruff configuration completed in pyproject.toml with rule sets for pycodestyle, pyflakes, isort, bugbear, comprehensions, pyupgrade, unused-arguments, and simplify. Pre-commit hook configured in .pre-commit-config.yaml.

title: Implement BeadsLifecycleManager class
description:
Implement the BeadsLifecycleManager class for managing Beads ticket creation and resolution monitoring.

**Class Structure:**
```python
class BeadsLifecycleManager:
    def __init__(self, config: dict)
    async def create_discrepancy_ticket(self, discrepancy: Discrepancy) -> str
    async def wait_for_resolution(self, ticket_keys: List[str], timeout_hours: int = 48) -> ResolutionResult
    async def apply_resolution(self, ticket_key: str) -> None
    def render_template(self, template_name: str, data: dict) -> str
    def parse_resolution(self, description: str, comments: List) -> Resolution
```

**Ticket Templates (from Section 5.1):**
1. Discrepancy Ticket:
   - Project: LEGACY_DOC
   - Issue type: Clarification
   - Summary: [AI-DOC] {discrepancy_type}: {component_id}
   - Labels: ai-documentation, {discrepancy_type}, iteration-{n}
   - Custom fields: cf_component_id, cf_stream_a_confidence, cf_stream_b_confidence, cf_auto_resolvable

2. Rebuild Ticket:
   - Project: REBUILD
   - Issue type: Story
   - Summary: Rebuild: {component_name}
   - Include full documentation, call graph, acceptance criteria

**Lifecycle Automation:**
- Register tickets for monitoring after creation
- Poll for resolution every 5 minutes
- Parse resolution from ticket description/comments
- Apply resolution to appropriate stream(s)
- Handle timeout (48 hours default) with partial proceed option

Reference: Section 5 of dual_stream_documentation_spec_v2.md

title: Implement core data models
description:
Implement all Pydantic models based on the architecture design:
- models/component.py: Component, CallEdge, CallGraph, CallGraphDiff
- models/documentation.py: DocumentationOutput, ValidationResult, ComparisonResult
- models/discrepancy.py: Discrepancy, ConvergenceCriteria, ConvergenceStatus
- models/package.py: DocumentationPackage, RebuildTicket
- models/config.py: ModelTier, ModelConfig, SystemConfig

Include JSON serialization methods and model validation.
Reference spec sections: 3.1, 3.2, 3.3

title: Write unit tests for AST parser
description:
Write unit tests for AST parsing and component discovery:
- tests/test_utils/test_ast_parser.py
- tests/test_utils/test_component_discovery.py
- tests/test_utils/test_topological_sort.py

Test cases:
- Parse simple functions
- Parse classes with methods
- Handle nested classes
- Extract parameters with type hints
- Extract return types
- Handle decorated functions
- Topological sort correctness
- Cycle detection
